game

Class GameParticle

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Element
      • game.GameParticle
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Obstacle

    public class GameParticle
extends Element
    The GameParticle class represents the generic game element.
    Version:
    2.0, June 2 2014 (Has all the methods - Thinking of just combining all into one, with param indicating level), 2.1, June 3 2014 (Deprecated EasyParticle, MediumParticle and DifficultParticle), 2.2, June 3 2014 (Removed unecessary code, update moves the particle one pixel at a time), 2.3, June 5 2014 (setReverseShift method), 2.4, June 5 2014. (JavaDoc, removed some methods)
    Author:
    Anqi Wu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean canMove
      canMove - private boolean - Stores whether the element can move.
      private int charge
      charge - private int - Stores the charge of the GameParticle.
      private boolean reverseShift
      reverseShift - private boolean - Stores whether the element should shift right.
      private boolean shift
      shift - private boolean - Stores whether the element should shift left.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameParticle

        public GameParticle(java.lang.String newName,
            Location newLocation,
            int charge,
            int level)
        Constructs a new GameParticle with the specified name, location and level.
        Parameters:
        newName - - String - The name of the element.
        newLocation - - Location - The location of the element.
        charge - - int - The charge of the GameParticle.
        level - - int - The level of the GameParticle.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates the location of the GameParticle. If the GameParticle can move, the location moves up by 1 pixel. Otherwise, if shift if true, then move the location to the cell to the left. shift is then set to false. If reverseShift is true, move the location to the cell to the right. reverseShift is then set to false. Overridden from the Element class.
        Specified by:
        update in class Element

      • setShift

        public void setShift(boolean set)
        Sets whether the element can shift to the left depending on the parameter. This method is used solely by inventory particles.
        Parameters:
        set - - boolean - Stores whether or not the element should shift to the left.

      • setReverseShift

        public void setReverseShift(boolean set)
        Sets whether the element can shift to the right depending on the parameter. This method is used solely by inventory particles.
        Parameters:
        set - - boolean - Stores whether or not the element should shift to the right.

      • updateBounce

        public void updateBounce()
        Updates whether the GameParticle travels outside the game boundaries. If the location is outside, the GameParticle's location is set to null.

      • getCharge

        public int getCharge()
        Returns the charge of the GameParticle.
